ygData.messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Obergfell, Steven [mailto:SObergfell@...]
> Sent: Friday, June 11, 1999 11:03 AM
> To: 'warriors_eq@onelist.com'
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Warriors vs Wizards
>
>
> From: "Obergfell, Steven" <SObergfell@...>
>
> OK. You rmaking some sense. Let's try and put together a
> reasonable offer.
>
> 1) Critical Hit as a Warrior only skill (maybe add Monk)

I really like this one. We need to really define this skill. Maybe we can
come up with some kind of frequency, damage, and such that we can "suggest"
to Verant as what we feel would be nice. Lets keep it reasonable, we dont
wanna ask to be superhuman. i.e. instant death on success.
I was thinking it could do a int or wiz check of some sort, concidering the
critical hit would be from lerning where and how to hit for maximum
efficiency. Also, all of our int and wizdoms should be relatively low to
minumize the actuall sucess of this skill. That way it does not get out of
hand. Maybe a 200point strike on sucess would be enough damage as well.
modified by strength and level of course.
>
> 2) Remove skill caps for warrior on the following skills:
> Offense, Defense,
> Dual weild, Dble attack.

This is probably one of the more important addition i would like to see.
But I would also like to see the removal of all weapon skill caps as well.
The way it is now, we cap at 200 on all weapon skills.
>
> 3) add specialization in weapons forms (1-handed slash, 2- handed slash,
> archery, etc.)

This is my second in line for preference of what to add. I think that
specialization similiar to the magic specialization would be great. the
benefits to specialization would be attack delay reduction, and minor damage
increase. maybe just double the strength modifier. more input would be
great on this.
>
> 4) Add a once a day ability Battle Cry (As a barbarian I really like this)
> That temporarily enhances fighting abilities.

This sounds pretty neat, tho i think this would be asking for too much.
Although it doesnt hurt to add it in.
>
> 5) Increase the effects of strength on damage and stamina on healing, but
> not drastically. Since these are primary attributes for a warrior this
> should help us out in being more effective in the early stages of
> combat and get us off our butts a little faster afterwards.

Instead of this, I read someone put a skill called sleep. this would
effectively double our rate of regeneration, but we would be blinded by a
black screen. I would also say we would have to have some kind of negative
to a skill like this other than just being blind. Maybe it takes us
something like 5 rounds to come out of a sleep or something. This would
make the use of it dangerous, tho with a group watching your back, it would
be beneficial.
>
>
> what do you think?
>
I think we are getting much closer to something we can present as a
pettition. lets just firm things up with solid definitions and a solid
order as to what we would like to see implemented, and we are there. Good
work guys.

I also think we have thought about this very logically and tried to keep
most of the requests within a balanced boundry of game play.

Dyvim Kincaid
Stormriders of Cazic Thule
